entities.name: Illegal Wildlife Trade
entities.description: The illegal wildlife trade involves the poaching and trafficking of animals, often for their body parts.

entities.name: INSECTS
entities.description: Small invertebrate animals that are a primary food source for the aye-aye and other animals

entities.name: AYE-AYE
entities.description: A lemur native to Madagascar with an elongated middle finger used to extract insects from tree bark, showcasing a unique foraging behavior

entities.name: PANGOLIN
entities.description: An animal with protective scales made of keratin that act as armor to shield it from predators, and is one of the most trafficked animals in the world due to the mistaken belief in the medicinal properties of its scales

entities.name: Breeding
entities.description: The process by which birds mate and produce offspring.

entities.name: Hair
entities.description: Hair is a protein filament that grows from follicles found in the dermis, or skin.

entities.name: MEXICO
entities.description: Country where the axolotl is native to

entities.name: wood surface
entities.description: A surface made of wood, commonly found in natural and man-made structures. It can be tapped by certain animals to detect hollow chambers or insects.

entities.name: ocean
entities.description: The ocean is a vast body of saltwater that covers approximately 71% of the Earth"s surface. It plays a crucial role in regulating climate, supporting biodiversity, and providing resources for human use.

attributes.Depth: Varies; can reach depths of over 36,000 feet
attributes.Light Availability: Decreases with depth, leading to light-starved conditions in the deep sea

entities.name: Earth
entities.description: Earth is the third planet from the Sun and the only known celestial body to support life. It is characterized by its diverse ecosystems, complex evolutionary processes, and a wide range of animal adaptations.

entities.name: wing shape
entities.description: The wing shape of the common swift is specialized for efficient gliding and long-duration flights.

entities.name: TROPICAL WATERS
entities.description: Warm and sunlit sea environments

entities.name: mollusks
entities.description: Mollusks are a diverse group of invertebrate animals that live in marine, freshwater, and terrestrial habitats. They include species such as snails, clams, octopuses, and squids.

attributes.Diet: Varies by species; some are herbivores, others are carnivores or omnivores

entities.name: miles
entities.description: A unit of length or distance, commonly used in the United States and the United Kingdom.

entities.name: animal kingdom
entities.description: The animal kingdom encompasses all multicellular, eukaryotic organisms that are capable of locomotion and have specialized tissues. It is characterized by a wide range of remarkable adaptations that enable animals to thrive in diverse environments.

attributes.Diversity: Includes a vast array of species with various physical traits, behaviors, and survival strategies.
attributes.Adaptations: Animals have evolved an astonishing array of adaptations to ensure their survival in challenging environments.

entities.name: specialized foraging techniques
entities.description: Specialized foraging techniques are unique methods that animals have developed to efficiently find and obtain food in their specific environments.

attributes.Purpose: To ensure survival by effectively locating and consuming prey or resources
attributes.Examples: Barreleye fish using peculiar adaptations to see prey, aye-aye using specialized digits to extract insects from tree bark

entities.name: shells of prey
entities.description: The shells of prey are protective structures that some animals use to defend against predators.

entities.name: long-duration flights
entities.description: Long-duration flights are extended periods of continuous flight without landing.

entities.name: Keratin
entities.description: Keratin is a family of fibrous structural proteins. It is the key structural material making up the outer layer of human skin, as well as the hair and nails.

entities.name: Medical Treatments for Humans
entities.description: Medical treatments are interventions designed to improve or restore health.

entities.name: Human Fingers and Toes
entities.description: Fingers and toes are the digits at the ends of hands and feet in humans.

entities.name: medicinal properties
entities.description: There is a mistaken belief that the scales of the pangolin have medicinal properties, leading to widespread trafficking.

entities.name: crabs and mollusks
entities.description: Crabs and mollusks are common marine animals that serve as prey for various predators.

entities.name: efficient gliding
entities.description: Efficient gliding is a method of flying that minimizes energy expenditure.

entities.name: crabs
entities.description: Crabs are decapod crustaceans, typically found in marine and freshwater environments. They have a hard exoskeleton and ten legs, with the front pair modified into claws.

entities.name: PREDATORS
entities.description: Animals that hunt and eat other animals, such as those that might prey on the pangolin

entities.name: hunting strategy
entities.description: Hunting strategies are specific behaviors or techniques used by predators to capture their prey.

entities.name: AIR
entities.description: The environment where the common swift spends most of its life, flying and feeding on insects

entities.name: .22 caliber bullet
entities.description: A .22 caliber bullet is a small, lightweight projectile commonly used in firearms. It is known for its high velocity and relatively low recoil.

entities.name: Animal Adaptations
entities.description: Animal adaptations refer to the traits and behaviors that have evolved in animals over time, allowing them to survive and thrive in their environments.

entities.name: club-like appendage
entities.description: A specialized club-like appendage found in the mantis shrimp, capable of accelerating faster than a speeding bullet.

entities.name: MADAGASCAR
entities.description: Island country where the aye-aye is native to

entities.name: humans
entities.description: Humans are the most intelligent and technologically advanced species on Earth, capable of complex reasoning, problem-solving, and cultural development.

entities.name: curling into a ball
entities.description: When threatened, the pangolin curls into a tight ball to protect itself.

entities.name: AXOLOTL
entities.description: A type of salamander native to Mexico with the unique ability to regenerate lost body parts, including limbs, tail, and even parts of its brain and spinal cord

entities.name: primates
entities.description: Primates are a diverse group of mammals that include humans, apes, monkeys, and prosimians. They are known for their advanced cognitive abilities, dexterity, and complex social structures.

attributes.Diversity of Adaptations: Primates exhibit a wide range of adaptations, including specialized behaviors such as the unique foraging technique of the aye-aye.
attributes.Cognitive Abilities: Advanced cognitive abilities are a hallmark of primates, enabling them to solve complex problems and use tools effectively.
attributes.Dexterity: Primates have highly dexterous hands and feet, which allow for precise manipulation of objects and movement through their environments.
attributes.Social Structures: Many primates live in complex social groups with intricate communication systems and hierarchical structures.

entities.name: Life
entities.description: Life encompasses all living organisms and their interactions with the environment. Earth is the only known planet to support life.

relations: The pangolin has evolved protective armor in the form of overlapping scales to defend against predators.
